definition: to visit sb at home

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men

sentences.english: Beryl came round this morning to apologize.
sentences.chinese: 贝丽尔今天上午来登门道歉了。

sentences.english: McGovern’s parents tried to offer a meal to any poor person who came by.
sentences.chinese: 麦戈文的父母亲尽量为任何登门的穷人提供一餐饭。

sentences.english: Premier Wen Jiabao visited Qian Lao each door, both a cordial conversation.
sentences.chinese: 温家宝每次登门看望钱老，两人都亲切交谈。

sentences.english: It happened that the Wangs were out when I called.
sentences.chinese: 当我登门拜访时，王先生一家不在。

sentences.english: Brenda : Juno, you can't just drop in on them like that.
sentences.chinese: 朱诺，你不能像那样随随便便就登门拜访的。

sentences.english: When he passed the State of Lu, some local scholars wanted to see him.
sentences.chinese: 当他路过鲁国时，鲁国有些学者想登门求见。

sentences.english: The customers noticed the difference---to judge from the way they behaved.
sentences.chinese: 顾客察觉到这一切变化，不再登门。

to call to pay one's respect/to call on
to turn up without being invited/unsolicited
to be refused entrance (idiom)/to find the door closed
pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
to propose marriage
to pay a return visit

to congratulate
to congratulate
to attend a banquet
we are honored by your presence
